com.opera.core.systems.runner.inprocess

Class ScreenCapture

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opera.core.systems.runner.inprocess.ScreenCapture

  • public class ScreenCapture
extends Object
    Utility for taking screen captures using Java. Example: 
    
   ScreenCapture capture = ScreenCapture.of(new Dimension(100, 200));
   try {
     System.out.println(capture.getMD5());
   } catch (IOException e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
   }
    See Also:
    of(), of(java.awt.Dimension)

    • Method Detail

      • take

        public void take()
          throws AWTException
        Takes the screen capture of the designated area. If no dimensions are specified, it will take a screenshot of the full screen by default.
        Throws:
        AWTException

      • getMd5

        public String getMd5()
              throws IOException
        Get the MD5 hash sum of the byte array of the data of the screen capture.
        Returns:
        the MD5 hash sum of this capture
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs

      • getData

        public byte[] getData()
        Get the a byte array of the raw data of this screen capture.
        Returns:
        raw data as a byte array

      • of

        public static ScreenCapture of()
                        throws IOException
        Takes a screen capture of the full screen.
        Returns:
        a capture of the whole screen
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs

      • of

        public static ScreenCapture of(Dimension dimensions)
                        throws IOException
        Takes a screen capture of the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - the dimensions of which to take a screen capture
        Returns:
        a capture of the designated dimensions
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs
